description.narrative: To strengthen land/forest management processes and biodiversity conservation in order to secure the flow of multiple ecosystems services while ensuring ecosystem resilience to climate change.
capital of a political entity
Pilot projects for SFMREDD and SLM reduce land degradation increase C stocks and strengthen BD conservation in southeastern and western Guatemala
10 Number of ha protected through REDD practices during a 5year period

comment.narrative: Progress of this target will be measured at year 5 of the project through the National Maps of forest cover and dynamics For this the project is supporting the national agencies INAB MARN CONAP MAGA in the process to define the best areas to implement the REDD project altogether with the MRV System That will help to ensure the best suitable areas of the regions are considered under the REDD practices At present there is a team of more than 8 technicians working full time to have all the geographical information in order to have all the information by the end of 2015

Progress of this target will be measured at year 5 of the project through the National Maps of forest cover and dynamics For this the project is supporting the national agencies INAB MARN CONAP MAGA in the process to define the best areas to implement the REDD project altogether with the MRV System That will help to ensure the best suitable areas of the regions are considered under the REDD practices At present there is a team of more than 8 technicians working full time to have all the geographical information in order to have all the information by the end of 2015

description.narrative: 11 Revenuegross contributions USD through reduction of emissions under REDD during a 5year period

comment.narrative: Progress of this target will be measured during year 5 of the project with the projects to be presented by the communities At present the project is helping the national government to construct the National REDD Strategy and the MRV system In this sense it is expected by the end of 2015 to have a base information on the possible VCUs available for the each of the main region cover by the project as well as some idea on the revenues that the communities might receive

Progress of this target will be measured during year 5 of the project with the projects to be presented by the communities At present the project is helping the national government to construct the National REDD Strategy and the MRV system In this sense it is expected by the end of 2015 to have a base information on the possible VCUs available for the each of the main region cover by the project as well as some idea on the revenues that the communities might receive

description.narrative: Regulatory and institutional framework integrates principles of sustainable forest management SFM and sustainable land management SLM and strengthens integrated environmental land management capacity
7 Number of national agencies working with interagency agreements that integrate principles of SFM and SLM

comment.narrative: 5 MARN MAGA INAB CONAP and ANAM

4 agenciesForest National Institute INAB Ministry of Agriculture Livestock and Food MAGA Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources MARN National Council of Protected Areas CONAP and General Secretariat of Planning SEGEPLAN includes principles of SLM and SFM in their policies by having a common understanding of the concepts on SLM SFM climate change and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity This was achieved by having consultation with legal representatives from the 4 agencies
5 MARN MAGA INAB CONAP and ANAM

4 agenciesForest National Institute INAB Ministry of Agriculture Livestock and Food MAGA Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources MARN National Council of Protected Areas CONAP and General Secretariat of Planning SEGEPLAN includes principles of SLM and SFM in their policies by having a common understanding of the concepts on SLM SFM climate change and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity This was achieved by having consultation with legal representatives from the 4 agencies

description.narrative: 6 National policies incorporate SLM and SFM considerations

comment.narrative:
Forest incentives program for small landowners
Law for the Protection and Improvement of the Environment
Forestry Policy

National Action Program to Combat Desertification and Drought PROANDYS updated
Agricultural Policy of Guatemala reformed

PROBOSQUE draft bill has been submitted to Congress PROBOSQUE is a new draft bill that aims to replace the almost finished Program de Incentivos Forestales PINFOR program as well as to create a better system to incentivize the forest management and also incorporates new forest ecosystems that were not recognized in the past subject to receive incentives Altogether the PORBOSQUE is using the forest as a basis to promote sustainable development in rural areas
For 2015 the target was to have a Policy on Land Degradation and the PROANDYS updated At present there is an update on all the biophysical and political information related to land degradation desertification and drought Also the objective strategic lines and principles are already drafted and accepted The strategic plan with actions is under consultation as well as the actualization process of the PROANDYS

National Action Program to Combat Desertification and Drought PROANDYS updated
Agricultural Policy of Guatemala reformed

PROBOSQUE draft bill has been submitted to Congress PROBOSQUE is a new draft bill that aims to replace the almost finished Program de Incentivos Forestales PINFOR program as well as to create a better system to incentivize the forest management and also incorporates new forest ecosystems that were not recognized in the past subject to receive incentives Altogether the PORBOSQUE is using the forest as a basis to promote sustainable development in rural areas
For 2015 the target was to have a Policy on Land Degradation and the PROANDYS updated At present there is an update on all the biophysical and political information related to land degradation desertification and drought Also the objective strategic lines and principles are already drafted and accepted The strategic plan with actions is under consultation as well as the actualization process of the PROANDYS

description.narrative: To strengthen landforest management processes and biodiversity conservation in order to secure the flow of multiple ecosystems services while ensuring ecosystem resilience to climate change
1 Number of hectares ha of humid forest under the CCB Standards in the western region BD2

comment.narrative:
Progress of this target will be measured by mid2016 before the midterm review which is planned for later 2016
There are preliminary maps developed by the prtoject together with FUNDAECO and in consultation with local communities indicating the priority areas for conservation of biodiversity under CCB Standars covering more than 1000 ha of humid forest

Progress of this target will be measured by mid2016 before the midterm review which is planned for later 2016

description.narrative:
4 Change in coverage ha and quality rapid assessment method of the forests in the dry areas
LD2

comment.narrative:
According to the latest map on forest coverage dynamics the area still the same as baseline 683847 ha
The map is generated by INAB and since there is no update on the map the official information is that the forest coverage is as stated at baseline
The expected target for 2015 was focused on having a GIS monitoring tool and the capacity building of the municipalities but this has not been reach mainly because the government has not agreed upon the GIS monitoring tool as well as the equipment needed for implementing the tool

According to the latest map on forest coverage dynamics the area still the same as baseline 683847 ha
The map is generated by INAB and since there is no update on the map the official information is that the forest coverage is as stated at baseline
The expected target for 2015 was focused on having a GIS monitoring tool and the capacity building of the municipalities but this has not been reach mainly because the government has not agreed upon the GIS monitoring tool as well as the equipment needed for implementing the tool

description.narrative:
2 Area ha by forest type under best management practices in LULUCF including monitoring of C stocks CCM5
Conserve and enhance carbon stocks in selected forested areas

comment.narrative:
Dry forest 6201 ha
Humid forest 97085 ha

Dry forest 1500 ha
Humid forest 13343 ha

Dry forest 2000 ha This was achieve with the joint work of the project with the Forest National Institute INAB as part the ongoing process to promote national incentives under the PINPEP modality
Humid forest 50 ha This was achieve with the work of FUNDAECO with the support of the project and in close collaboration and participation of the local communities and the National Forest Institute INAB as well as the support of the local authorities The annual goal was not met due to two factors the first is that the natural regeneration for this ecosystem is slow and takes more time And secondly for the lack of resources economic and plants to promote the natural regeneration and rehabilitation of the forest
The expected target for 2015 was to have a first trial of the methods in the monitoring of C stocks but this methodology still is under construction as part of the REDD National Strategy

Dry forest 1500 ha
Humid forest 13343 ha

Dry forest 2000 ha This was achieve with the joint work of the project with the Forest National Institute INAB as part the ongoing process to promote national incentives under the PINPEP modality
Humid forest 50 ha This was achieve with the work of FUNDAECO with the support of the project and in close collaboration and participation of the local communities and the National Forest Institute INAB as well as the support of the local authorities The annual goal was not met due to two factors the first is that the natural regeneration for this ecosystem is slow and takes more time And secondly for the lack of resources economic and plants to promote the natural regeneration and rehabilitation of the forest
The expected target for 2015 was to have a first trial of the methods in the monitoring of C stocks but this methodology still is under construction as part of the REDD National Strategy

description.narrative:
3 Area ha rehabilitated by forest type CCM5
Reforestation with native species natural regeneration and sustainable agroforestry and silvopastoral systems

comment.narrative:
Dry forest 7915 ha
Humid forest 151315 ha

Dry forest 3000 ha
Humid forest 547 ha

Dry forest 200 ha This was achieve with the work of the National Forest Institute INAB with the support of the project and the involvement of local authorities and other actors like farmers nongovernmental organizations and private companies as part of their Corporate Social Responsibility Program
Humid forest 50 ha This was achieve with the work of FUNDAECO with the support of the project and in close collaboration and participation of the local communities and the National Forest Institute INAB as well as the support of the local authorities
The targets for 2015 are At least 200 ha of Dry Forest rehabilitated and at least 1000 ha of Humid Montane Forest rehabilitated

description.narrative: (1) Number of hectares (ha) of humid forest under the CCB Standards in the western region (BD-2) (2) Area (ha) under best management practices in LULUCF*, including monitoring of C stocks (CCM-5) (Dry forest ) (3) Area (ha) under best management practices in LULUCF*, including monitoring of C stocks (CCM-5) (Humid forest ) (4) Area (ha) rehabilitated* (Dry forest) (5) Area (ha) rehabilitated* (Humid forest) (6) Avoided emissions (tCO2-e) from deforestation by forest type during a 5-year period (Dry forest ) (7) Avoided emissions (tCO2-e) from deforestation by forest type during a 5-year period (Humid forest ) (8) National policies incorporate SLM and SFM considerations (9) tCO2-e sequestered through dry forest rehabilitation (10) Revenue/gross contributions (USD) through reduction of emissions under Forest Incentives during a 5-year period. ($- Dry forest ) (11) tCO2-e sequestered through humid montane forest rehabilitation (12) Revenue/gross contributions (USD) through reduction of emissions under Forest incentives during a 5-year period. ($-humid forest ) (13) Number of key species by biological groups (amphibians and plants) present in the project area
